job_tasks.phrase: Write and ship production code that has meaningful user and business impact
job_tasks.justification: Describes the core activity of developing and deploying software.

job_tasks.phrase: Envision, build and analyse new features and tools, each contributing to company growth and revenue
job_tasks.justification: Refers to the creation and analysis of new software features and tools.

job_tasks.phrase: Help HubSpot users meet their goals, via changes you've made
job_tasks.justification: Indicates the outcome of software development, where implemented changes benefit users.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement experiments that give us valuable insights into user behavior and how to improve their experience
job_tasks.justification: Involves building and deploying experiments, a software development task, to gather insights.

job_tasks.phrase: Get exposure to how HubSpot works as a business
job_tasks.justification: Directly relates to understanding the broader business context and strategic alignment.

soft_skills.phrase: Work with a small cross-functional team of engineers, PMs, designers, content designers, and researchers
Collaborate with HubSpotters all over the company, whether in engineering, product, design, research, marketing, sales, etc
Help HubSpot users meet their goals, via changes you've made
Implement experiments that give us valuable insights into user behavior and how to improve their experience
Get exposure to how HubSpot works as a business

profile.rationale: The job description focuses entirely on traditional software engineering tasks (writing and shipping production code, building features, implementing experiments) within a frontend context for marketing enablement. There is no mention of AI, machine learning, generative AI, or related specialized tasks or technologies, which are prerequisites for any of the AI/ML-focused profiles. The role's responsibilities align exclusively with Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering).

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is exceptionally clear about its focus on traditional software engineering and explicitly lacks any AI/ML components, making the classification unambiguous.
